push local to heroku: Amazon S3
Secret access key
Access key ID
Dump your local database in compressed format using the open source pg_dump tool:
git push heroku master: PGPASSWORD=VE1005gan pg_dump -Fc --no-acl --no-owner -h localhost -U Adam bdsage_development > bdsage_local.dump
IMPORTING BACKUP DATA INTO HEROKU APP

1. $ PGPASSWORD=VE1005gan pg_dump -Fc --no-acl --no-owner -h localhost -U Adam bdsage_development > bdsage_local.dump* bdsage_development: (not sure why we need it) same as local postgresql database name. It is listed in here(sdf_app/config/database.yml) under development:".

push local to heroku: * bdsage_local.dump: actual dump file name. You can name it whatever you want.
* VE1005gan: password. Make sure mask it when you want to send this."". $ PGPASSWORD=VE1005gan pg_dump -Fc --no-acl --no-owner -h localhost -U Adam bdsage_development > bdsage_local.dump
* bdsage_development: (not sure why we need it)"

git push heroku master: 2. If you do step 1, the dump file will be downloaded in the app's root directory.
3. Go to aws.amazon.com". And Go to "S3". Click "Upload" then upload the dump file that was created from step 2.

git push heroku master: 4. Click the dump file and go to Permissions" on top. (NOT the bucket's permissions tap)"". Click the dump file and go to "Permissions" on top. ("" Click the dump file a"
5. Make everyone READ/WRITE-able. And make it public.

6. $ heroku pg:backups:restore 'https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/bds-max/bdsage_local.dump' postgresql-animated-81852* url is where the dump file is in S3.* postgresql-animated-81852: This is the heroku database name.
7. You will see all the heroku data is replaced with the dump file.
PII: IMPORTING HEROKU TO LOCAL MACHINE
$ heroku pg:backups:capture$ heroku pg:backups:download$ pg_restore --verbose --clean --no-acl --no-owner -h localhost -U Adam -d bdsage_development latest.dump
